so what we encourage you to do is really stack rank all of your it assets and make sure that you're evaluating which ones are really applicable to move into
the cloud we certainly don't Advocate that it's an all or nothing proposition
that you have to move all of your applications into the cloud or none of them we highly recommend that you evaluate which ones make most sense and

you move across those those different uh categories now we've spoken to a lot of
Enterprises and in the process we've identified that there really three key usage patterns that we we've seen

much the same level of of uh intensity or utilization on a regular basis then
we have spiky predictable workloads think of things these things like um payroll that has to be run once a month

across different regions uh data transfer varies as well depending on the region that you're actually pulling the

actually pay per amount and just to summarize our our cost structure very
simply in terms of running capacity those machines are charged on a per hour basis in terms of storage we charge on a

that we're not using for on demand or reserved instances we can allocate those to customers in the spot Market of
course there are occasional times when demand will actually drive the price above the on demand price and there are

someone else were to bid a higher amount on the same capacity we then take that capacity from the first customer and
give it to the second customer without warning so the dedication of of using
spot prices requires that you actually architect your infrastructure and architect your application in such a way

reasoning here is that even though on occasion they might have to pay the on demand price the vast majority of the
